    • Field Detail

      • pos

        protected org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos
        Setting the position to null after the menu is rendered does not re-query a position from the menus PositionProvider. The PositionProvider will only be invoked once, as the item it is #putOnPage.

      • uiid

        protected java.util.UUID uiid

      • getUniqueId

        public java.util.UUID getUniqueId()
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        Uniquely identifies this element within the menu.
        This ID may not be copied by copy(), use a new random one.
        Specified by:
        getUniqueId in interface IElement
        Specified by:
        getUniqueId in interface org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable
        Returns:
        a unique id for this element within the menu.

      • getPosition

        public org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos getPosition()
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        This value is only relevant for GUIs. It returns where the element is positioned within the inventory space.
        If this returns null the element will not render.
        Specified by:
        getPosition in interface IElement
        Returns:
        the X and Y coordinated within the menu page

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(@Nullable
                        @Nullable org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos position)
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        Can move the item on the page it is put on.
        If you want to query the PositionProvider to set this elements position, use either the Builder. Auto positions become unavailable once the element is placed.
        The inventory will always be 9 wide, but the height depends on how the menu was initialized.
        Note that elements can overlap and ALL overlapping elements will receive interaction events at once!
        Specified by:
        setPosition in interface IElement
        Parameters:
        position - The new X and Y coordinated to render this element at.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(IMenu menu)
        Called by the menu when the element gets added to it. Allows the element to reference the menu it belongs to through .getParent(), results in element only being usable on one menu.
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu this element was added to

      • getParent

        public IMenu getParent()
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        This will return the IMenu the Element was added to
        Specified by:
        getParent in interface IElement
        Returns:
        the IMenu this IElement was added to

      • hookThinkTick

        public void hookThinkTick(Tickable hook)
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        A single object that can be registered to implement more complex behaviour.

        Specified by:

      • think

        public boolean think(AnimationManager animations,
                     org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        Copied from MenuRenderer::think
        this method shall update all animated IElements within the menu.
        Specified by:
        think in interface IElement
        Parameters:
        animations - is a tracker to prevent double frame advancement for shared anim objects
        viewer - the Player currently viewing this element
        Returns:
        true if an animation progressed during this think tick and the menu needs to redraw.
